author: Noé Chartier
description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith and federal Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre have welcomed reports of political interest on both sides of the border in reviving a pipeline project linking Alberta’s oil sands to the United States. “We are glad to hear President Trump and his administration express renewed interest in the Keystone XL pipeline,” Poilievre said […]
title: Smith, Poilievre Welcome Prospects of Reviving Keystone XL Pipeline After Carney-Trump Meeting

author: Chandra Philip
description: Nova Scotia RCMP say despite the use of cadaver dogs, they have failed to find any clues in a case of two missing children in that province. Lilly Sullivan, 6, and Jack Sullivan, 4, were reported missing on May 2 from their home on Gairloch Road in Lansdowne Station, about 140 kilometres northeast of Halifax. […]
title: No Human Remains Found as Search for Missing Nova Scotia Siblings Continues: RCMP

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: The Burned Parliament in Nepal, Keir Starmer in India, and Livestock Summit

author: Jacob Burg
description: 'I may go there sometime toward the end of the week, maybe on Sunday ... negotiations are going along very well,' Trump said.
title: Trump Says Team ‘Very Close’ to Gaza Peace Deal

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney says there’s been progress made following his visit to the U.S. capital, which included a dinner with U.S. Vice President JD Vance. Carney went to Washington, D.C., to meet with U.S. President Donald Trump this week to discuss trade, security, and defence. No deal was announced after the meeting, but Carney […]
title: Carney Dined With US VP Vance, Says ‘Progress’ Achieved During Washington Visit

author: Chandra Philip
description: Ontario’s minister of education has condemned a Toronto-area high school after the Canadian national anthem was played in Arabic on Oct. 7, the anniversary of the Hamas attack in Israel. Education Minister Paul Calandra said he was disappointed that the school chose to play “O Canada” in Arabic on the two-year anniversary of Hamas’ deadly […]
title: Ontario Minister Condemns High School for Playing ‘O Canada’ in Arabic on Anniversary of Hamas Attack

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s former associate who will oversee Ottawa’s new Defence Investment Agency could be cabinet’s highest paid appointee. Toronto banker Doug Guzman was appointed CEO of Canada’s new Defence Investment Agency when it was launched on Oct. 2. The agency, which will operate within Public Services and Procurement Canada, aims to speed up defence […]
title: Ottawa’s New Defence Agency CEO Could Earn up to $679K Salary

author: The Canadian Press
description: While Prime Minister Mark Carney left a meeting in Washington without any trade deal breakthroughs, he’s still garnering support from the leaders of some of Canada’s biggest companies for his approach. Speaking at a conference in Toronto hosted by BMO and Eurasia Group, the chief executives of Enbridge Inc. and CPKC Ltd., along with Alberta […]
title: Executives Say Focus on Mutual Wins Key to Breakthrough on US Trade

author: The Canadian Press
description: Picket lines were set up Wednesday in front of all remaining British Columbia-run liquor and cannabis stores in the province as public service workers step up union job action. The escalation by the BC General Employees’ Union also includes all Service BC workers, raising the total number of members participating in job action to almost […]
title: All BC Government Liquor, Cannabis Stores Now Behind Workers’ Pickets in Escalation

author: Frank Fang
description: 'This legislation will ensure America is prepared to hit China where it hurts,' Sen. James Risch says.
title: Senator Introduces Legislation to Deter China’s Aggression Against Taiwan

author: Noé Chartier
description: As the federal government seeks to amend the Citizenship Act, Conservative MPs have made an unsuccessful attempt to limit birthright citizenship, saying a decade of “misguided” policy has broken the consensus on immigration. The House of Commons is currently reviewing Bill C-3, which aims, among other things, to ensure citizenship by descent is granted to […]
title: Tories’ Attempt to Limit Birthright Citizenship Fails in Committee

author: Alex Wu
description: Business owners and residents say the actual situation is worse than what official data show.
title: China’s ‘Golden Week’ Holiday Shows Weak Consumption Amid Economic Slowdown

author: The Canadian Press
description: A Winnipeg judge has stayed charges against former fashion mogul Peter Nygard. Nygard’s lawyer had argued in court the charges of sexual assault and unlawful confinement should be stayed because of police bungling. Nygard was charged in 2023 after police said a woman came forward with allegations she was sexually assaulted at a warehouse in […]
title: Winnipeg Judge Stays Charges Against Former Fashion Mogul Peter Nygard

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Premier Doug Ford is promising to table legislation this month that will obligate publicly funded institutions and municipalities to prioritize Ontario-made products and services in response to the ongoing trade disputes with the United States. The province will be pushing for a “Buy Ontario” approach when the legislature resumes in the coming weeks, Ford told […]
title: Premier Ford Planning ‘Buy Ontario’ Bill When Legislature Resumes

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre says Freedom Convoy organizers Tamara Lich and Chris Barber “peacefully” protested restrictions brought in by the Liberal government’s invocation of the Emergencies Act, and that the presiding judge was right to reject the Crown’s request for their imprisonment.  Ontario Court Justice Heather Perkins-McVey ruled on Oct. 7 that Barber and Lich […]
title: Poilievre Says Lich and Barber Protested Peacefully, Judge Right to Reject Crown’s Jail Request

author: Catherine Yang
description: Gulf and Middle East nations that have recovered drones operated by Iranian terrorist proxies have led to the identification of the 10 Chinese companies.
title: US Targets Chinese Companies Supplying Hamas, Houthis Drones

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Ottawa’s recent call for limits on the notwithstanding clause poses a threat to “national unity” and signifies a disregard for the process that resulted in the establishment of the Charter of Rights and Freedoms, five premiers say. The leaders of Ontario, Quebec, Alberta, Saskatchewan, and Nova Scotia are speaking out against the federal government’s appeal […]
title: 5 Premiers Urge Carney to Retract Court Submission on Notwithstanding Clause

author: Reuters
description: BEIJING—Rescuers guided all of the remaining trekkers near the east face of Everest in Tibet to safety on Tuesday, including hundreds of local guides and yak herders, authorities said. Hundreds of hikers were stranded in deep snow over the weekend in the isolated Karma valley after an unusually powerful blizzard dumped heavy snowfall in the […]
title: All Stranded Everest Hikers Evacuated From Remote Tibetan Valley

author: Chandra Philip
description: Calgary residents have seen their property taxes nearly double since 2016, making it the city with the highest tax burden in Canada, according to a new report. Released on Oct. 8, the analysis by the Aristotle Foundation for Public Policy used Statistics Canada 2016 and 2021 census data to compare property tax rates “in absolute […]
title: Calgary Homeowners See Highest Increase in Property Tax Burden in Canada: Report

author: Adam Morrow
description: The truce follows recent flare-up of violence in two Kurdish districts of Aleppo.
title: US-Backed Kurdish Group, Damascus Agree to Cease-Fire in Northern Syria

author: Epoch Video
description: The International Monetary Fund’s managing director Kristalina Georgieva delivers preview of upcoming IMF-World Bank Annual Meetings at 10 a.m. ET on Oct. 8.
title: REPLAY: IMF’s Georgieva Speaks Ahead of IMF–World Bank Annual Meetings

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: A New Brunswick seafood processing company has been fined $1 million and banned from using a government program to hire foreign workers for failing to comply with federal and provincial labour laws. Bolero Shellfish Processing Inc., located in Saint-Simon, N.B., received the maximum financial penalty on Sept. 17 for failing to offer appropriate wages and […]
title: NB Seafood Company Fined $1M for Foreign Worker Program Violation

author: Guy Birchall
description: The reduction from Washington came amid the abolition of the U.S. Agency for International Development earlier this year.
title: US Aid Cuts ‘Long Overdue,’ Says Zambian President

author: The Canadian Press
description: High school football players sidelined as a result of the Alberta teachers strike are getting some gridiron help from the CFL’s Edmonton Elks. The strike, which enters Day 3 on Wednesday, means a number of school sports teams are having their seasons put on hold indefinitely, including high school football, flag football, volleyball and soccer. […]
title: Edmonton Elks Organize Free Camp for High School Football Players Sidelined by Strike

author: Victoria Friedman
description: Primary among Europe's strategies is the 'drone wall,' a proposed system to detect, track, and intercept unmanned aerial vehicles violating the bloc's airspace.
title: Europe Must Focus Defense Strategy to Respond to Hybrid Warfare, Says EU Chief

author: The Canadian Press
description: The union representing striking Canada Post employees says it will meet with the federal minister in charge of the Crown corporation after accusing Ottawa of trampling on the collective bargaining process. Postal workers took to the picket lines nearly two weeks ago after Procurement Minister Joël Lightbound announced sweeping changes to Canada Post’s mandate that […]
title: Canada Post Union Set for Meeting With Ottawa as Strike Stretches On

author: Naveen Athrappully
description: Stolen funds are believed to be funneled to the North Korean regime’s weapons programs.
title: $2 Billion in Cryptoassets Stolen by North Korean Hackers in 2025: Report

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The EU steelmaking industry is the world's third largest steel producer, with production sites across more than 20 member states.
title: EU Plans to Double Steel Tariffs, Cut Import Quotas in Bid to Protect Industry

author: Chris Summers
description: On Oct. 8, Conservative lawmaker Alicia Kearns said, 'The government must come clean. Who is responsible for spiking the prosecution?'
title: Chief Prosecutor Blames UK Government for Collapse of China Spying Trial

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Trump’s 20-point Gaza peace plancalls for an immediate ceasefire, expanded aid and the release of all hostages within 72 hours of Israel’s approval.
title: Hostage, Prisoner Lists Exchanged for Gaza Peace Plan: Hamas

author: Travis Gillmore
description: Administration officials called for the immediate release of the 48 remaining hostages held by Hamas terrorists in the Gaza Strip.
title: Trump Meets Freed Hostage Edan Alexander on Oct. 7 Anniversary

author: PA Media
description: A 61-year-old man has been found guilty of stalking TV and radio star Myleene Klass by posting to her an air pistol, handcuffs, a police uniform and “disturbing” unwanted letters. Jurors also convicted Peter Windsor of stalking Klass’s Classic FM colleague Katie Breathwick by sending her details of a DIY will-writing kit and other “raving” […]
title: Stalker Found Guilty of Targeting Myleene Klass by Posting Air Gun and Handcuffs

author: PA Media
description: UK nationals exceeding post-Brexit limits on how long they can spend in the EU have been warned they will be ‘automatically detected’ through a new border system coming into force this week. Travel trade organisation Abta said enforcement of the limit of 90 days in a 180-day period has previously been widely ignored. It warned […]
title: UK Citizens Overstaying in EU Warned They Will Be ‘Automatically Detected’

author: PA Media
description: Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) has revealed a sharp drop in sales over recent months as it prepares to restart production across its UK sites on Wednesday after weeks of disruption following a cyber attack. The British carmaker said it had been a “challenging quarter” as it also grappled with the impact of higher US tariffs. […]
title: JLR Reveals Tumbling Sales as It Is Set to Restart Production After Shutdown

author: PA Media
description: Twenty councillors have walked away from the Conservatives to join Reform UK, as Kemi Badenoch admits her party is “shedding a lot of baggage”. Nigel Farage’s party unveiled the wave defections on Tuesday, the eve of the Conservative annual conference finale in Manchester where Mrs Badenoch will make a closing speech. The boost to Reform […]
title: 20 Tory Councillors Join Reform UK on Eve of Conservative Conference Finale

author: PA Media
description: University leaders have urged students protesting on the anniversary of the October 7 attacks to think carefully about their actions, as the Prime Minister described the demonstrations as “un-British”. Pro-Palestine protesters are set to defy Sir Keir Starmer’s call not to demonstrate on the second anniversary of the October 7 attacks, with students from several […]
title: University Leaders Warn Student Pro-Palestine Protesters to ‘Think Carefully’

author: PA Media
description: Robert Jenrick urged the Conservatives to “take our country back” as he told the party conference Britain was “too precious to lose”. The shadow justice secretary ended his speech to the Conservative conference in Manchester with heavy praise for Britain, saying: “We may be a little bit down, but our country is not out.” Moving […]
title: Jenrick Urges Conservatives to ‘Take Our Country Back’

author: Reuters
description: PARIS—Iran reported an outbreak of the highly contagious H5N1 bird flu virus in poultry in the northern part of the country, the World Organisation for Animal Health said on Tuesday, citing a report from Iranian authorities. The outbreak killed 10 birds out of a flock of 90, the WOAH said. All other birds were slaughtered, […]
title: Iran Reports Bird Flu Outbreak in Poultry, WOAH Says

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: State and federal governments have combined efforts to provide a funding boost to Glencore's embattled Queensland facilities.
title: Federal, State Governments Pledge $600 Million Lifeline to Save Copper Smelter and Refinery

description: The two prime ministers also discussed the recent Optus incident.
title: Defence, Green Energy, Space: Australia, Singapore Upgrade Strategic Partnership

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Indigenous Australians Minister Malarndirri McCarthy has earmarked the introduction of penalties to help with enforcing targets.
title: No Clear Picture of Where Millions in Funding Going for Aboriginal ‘Closing the Gap’ Targets

author: The Associated Press
description: NEW YORK—Aaron Judge hit a tying homer and drove in four runs during a clutch performance for the ages, and the New York Yankees staved off elimination by rallying from five runs down to defeat the Toronto Blue Jays 9-6 on Tuesday night in Game 3 of their AL Division Series. Jazz Chisholm Jr. launched […]
title: Judge Rallies Yankees Past Blue Jays 9-6 to Save Season and Avert ALDS Sweep

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: New National Security Investigations (NSI) teams are being launched in 3 cities, with a strategy that goes beyond investigation and enforcement.
title: New National Security Teams to Target People Damaging Social Cohesion

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: An new assessment of cybercrime in Australia shows scammers are successfully targeting some victims more than once, prompting a new warning from police.
title: 40 Percent of Scam Victims Hit Multiple Times a Year

author: The Associated Press
description: STOCKHOLM—Three scientists won the Nobel Prize in physics Tuesday for research on the strange behavior of subatomic particles called quantum tunneling that enables the ultra-sensitive measurements achieved by MRI machines and lays the groundwork for better cellphones and faster computers. The work by John Clarke, Michel H. Devoret, and John M. Martinis, who work at […]
title: 3 Scientists at US Universities Win Nobel Prize in Physics for Advancing Quantum Technology

author: Reuters
description: An earthquake of magnitude 6.6 struck near Papua New Guinea’s second largest city Lae on Tuesday, the U.S. Geological Survey said, terrifying mourners in a stadium but with no damage immediately reported. The epicentre was 26 km (16 miles) from Lae, which has a population of over 76,000, according to the USGS. It was also […]
title: Quake of Magnitude 6.6 Shakes Lae City in Papua New Guinea

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: New body to make risk-based parole assessments for federal offenders, removing political influence and prioritising public safety
title: New Independent Board to Make Decisions on Releasing Federal Offenders

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: A new counterterrorism bill introduces powers to target state sponsors of terrorism after ASIO links Iranian forces to anti-Semitic attacks.
title: Australia Moves to List Iran’s Revolutionary Guard as Terror Group

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The Liberal government has plans to rework its border security bill following criticism about how the legislation’s proposed sweeping changes could affect privacy and civil liberties. Public Safety Minister Gary Anandasangaree gave notice to the House of Commons on Oct. 6 that he will introduce a new bill on borders and immigration as early as […]
title: Liberals Set to Introduce Revised Border Security Bill in Response to Privacy Concerns

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith says she’s open to revisiting the province’s industrial carbon pricing system as part of ongoing talks with Ottawa about federal regulations and Alberta’s resource development. Smith made the comments during an Oct. 7 press conference in Ottawa, a day after meeting with Prime Minister Mark Carney ahead of his visit to […]
title: Premier Smith Says Alberta’s Industrial Carbon Pricing ‘Open for Discussion’ After Meeting With Carney

author: Monica O’Shea
description: South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas raised concerns about the 'Americanisation' of Australian politics .
title: Turning Point South Australia Launches State Chapter Ahead of Election

author: Sean Tseng
description: Scale and speed—not a perfect design—will decide drone warfare, pushing Washington to cut red tape and ship autonomous fleets by the thousands, analysts say.
title: Why Drones Are Center of Potential US–China Warfare
